background: A lawn mowing service uses small and large teams to mow lawns, with different numbers of employees and capacities for each team size.
constraints: Number of employees in small teams plus number of employees in large teams is less than or equal to TotalEmployees
Number of small teams is non-negative
Number of large teams is non-negative
Number of small teams is at least MinRatioSmallToLarge times the number of large teams
There are at least MinLargeTeams large teams
There are at least MinSmallTeams small teams
objective: Maximize the total area of lawn mowed
description: A lawn mowing service provides neighborhood services using small teams and large teams. A small team requires \param{SmallTeamEmployees} employees and can mow \param{SmallTeamArea} sq ft of lawn. A large team requires \param{LargeTeamEmployees} employees and can mow \param{LargeTeamArea} sq ft of lawn. The company has \param{TotalEmployees} employees available. Because most people have smaller lawns in the city, the number of small teams must be at least \param{MinRatioSmallToLarge} times as much as the number of large teams. In addition, to make sure the company can meet all demands, there has to be at least \param{MinLargeTeams} large teams and at least \param{MinSmallTeams} small teams. How many of each team type should be used to maximize the amount of lawn that can be mowed?

parameters.definition: Number of employees required for a small team
Lawn area mowed by a small team
Number of employees required for a large team
Lawn area mowed by a large team
Minimum ratio of the number of small teams to large teams
